member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.OutlookBarGroup
member.summary: Represents a headered content area in a (commonly referred to as a 'group') that displays image and text in the header and developer-supplied content in the content area.
member.remarks: OutlookBarGroups can appear in any of 3 locations in the control: the navigation area, the overflow area and the overflow context menu. When displayed in one of these areas, only the OutlookBarGroup's header is shown. When an OutlookBarGroup is selected, its header (with image and/or text) and content also appear in the selected group area.

member.summary: Gets/sets the DefaultSmallIconTemplate of XamOutlookBar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamOutlookBar.GroupsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection used to generate the content of the .

remarks.p: The developer can use only one of or properties to add groups to the control. This allows the Groups collection to be populated via a binding on the GroupsSource property. When GroupsSource is in use, setting this property to null will remove the collection and restore use to Groups (which will be an empty collection).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamOutlookBar.DefaultGroupsContainer
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTemplate that will be used as a container when the items are being generated.

remarks.p: This property takes effect only to the items that are not native containers of the control.

The root element of the template provided by DefaultGroupsContainer should be the native container of the control - . If the root content of the DataTemplate is not an OutlookBarGroup, the property will be ignored and an Empty OutlookBarGroup will be used instead

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Menus.XamOutlookBar.NavigationAreaMaxGroups
